title: Petrified Forest National Park: Places
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Places               Places         Partially excavated rooms at Puerco Pueblo NPS/VIP Andrew Kearns  Petrified Forest National Park has many places of historic and cultural significance. Some are buildings, such as Agate House and Painted Desert Inn, while some are landscapes to explore, such as Rainbow Forest and the Painted Desert. Quite a few are listed on the National Register of Historic Places.   Points of Interest:  Agate Bridge Agate House Blue Mesa Crystal Forest Jasper Forest Newspaper Rock Painted Desert Community Complex Painted Desert Inn National Historic Landmark Painted Desert Wilderness Area Puerco Pueblo Route 66 Alignment Rainbow Forest area   Â   National Register of Historic Places:Agate House Pueblo, added 1975 Painted Desert Inn, added 1975Flattop Site, added 1976Newspaper Rock Petroglyphs Archeological District, added 1976Painted Desert Petroglyphs and Ruins Archeological District, added 1976 Puerco Ruin and Petroglyphs, added 1976 Twin Buttes Archeological District, added 1976Thirty-Fifth Parallel Route, added 1977 (also known as Beale Camel Trail) Painted Desert Inn added 1987 as a national historic landmarkPetrified Forest Bridge, added 1998 (also known as Rio Puerco Bridge)Painted Desert Community Complex Historic District, added 2005
